#summary Install Unity2D on Ubuntu to improve performance
#labels Linux,Ubuntu,Unity2D,performance

= Introduction =

Unity2D is an alternative windows manager to Unity which is currently (2014-10-20) the default in Ubuntu. It requires fewer resources and interferes less with Psychtoolbox. Using it could potentially improve timing precision and reduce missed flips in your experiments.


= Details =

Information on how to install and use Unity2D is found on [https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Unity2D https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Unity2D].
